item.title: github: GitHub MCP Server: New Projects tools, OAuth scope filtering, and new features
item.description:
GitHub released the MCP Server, adding improved management for GitHub Projects with more efficient use of the context window, automatic filtering of tools based on a token’s OAuth scopes/permissions, and additional new features and Projects-focused tools.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: The GitHub MCP Server adds support for tool-specific configuration, and more
item.description:
GitHub announced that the MCP Server now supports tool-specific configuration so you can customize behavior per tool and reduce context window usage. The feature is exposed via a new X-MCP-Tools header and was listed on the GitHub Blog changelog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Availaible: Azure MCP Server support for Azure confidential ledger
item.description:
Azure has announced general availability of MCP (Model Context Protocol) Server support for Azure Confidential Ledger. The MCP Server enables streamlined management of Azure resources, including Confidential Ledger, via natural-language prompts, simplifying interactions and operational workflows.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Native Microsoft Foundry support for Azure Database for PostgreSQL
item.description:
Microsoft announced the public preview of native Microsoft Foundry support for Azure Database for PostgreSQL. The Azure PostgreSQL MCP Server is now integrated with Microsoft Foundry, enabling the creation of AI agents that can securely query and analyze PostgreSQL data.

  • Source: Azure Updates
